com.fermitech.jocasta.jobs

Class Job

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fermitech.jocasta.jobs.Job
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    InJob, OutJob

    public abstract class Job
extends java.lang.Object
    This is the main Job abstract class, from wich all jobs inherit the basic attributes and bufferControl method.

        public Job(java.lang.String source,
           java.lang.String destination)
    throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This is the Job class constructor.
        Parameters:
        source - the absolute path to the source file, which may not exist yet.
        destination - the absolute path to the destination file.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException

      • execute

        public void execute()
             throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                    java.io.IOException
        This is the execute method. Since daisy-chained jobs may contain non-existant files when they are created, the file object gets initialized here. Same thing happens for the FileInputStream.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException
        java.io.IOException

      • bufferControl

        protected void bufferControl(long value,
                             java.io.OutputStream outputStream)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        This is the bufferControl method. Since it would be unhealty to load an entire file into memory, bufferControl loads a small chunk (max_size contains the maximum size of the chunk) and takes care of the leftover bytes that do not fit a single read.
        Parameters:
        value - the size of the whole file.
        outputStream - the OutputStream that will write the new file onto disk.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • writer

        protected void writer(java.io.OutputStream outputStream,
                      long size)
               throws java.io.IOException
        This is the writer method. It creates a buffer of given size (size<=max_size), reads from the input stream a given quanity of bytes (his size) and if the read operation was successful, it writes onto the final file.
        Parameters:
        outputStream - the OutputStream that will write the new file onto disk.
        size - the size of the next chunk.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • delete

        protected void delete(java.lang.String path)

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
